definitions.example: If you don't act soon, you will be in trouble.
I started acting at the age of eleven in my local theatre.

definitions.definition: Of a play: to be acted out (well or badly).
To behave in a certain manner for an indefinite length of time.
definitions.example: A dog which acts aggressively is likely to bite.

definitions.definition: To convey an appearance of being.
definitions.example: He acted unconcerned so the others wouldn't worry.

definitions.definition: To do something that causes a change binding on the doer.
(construed with on or upon) To have an effect (on).
definitions.example: Gravitational force acts on heavy bodies.
He's been acting Shakespearean leads since he was twelve.
He acted the angry parent, but was secretly amused.

definitions.definition: (construed with on or upon, of a group) To map via a homomorphism to a group of automorphisms (of).
definitions.example: This group acts on the circle, so it can't be left-orderable!

definitions.definition: To move to action; to actuate; to animate.
